title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the Intertropical Convergence Zone (where winds from the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere converge) further affects the island’s weather.

title: Voting starts in Australia election with Albanese’s labor ahead
byline: Voting has started across Australia’s heavily-populated eastern coast in the 2025 election, with opinion polls indicating that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is on track to become the first leader to win consecutive ballots in more than two decades.

title: ‘Removal of Landmines in the North and East is a national imperative’ – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the removal of landmines in the Northern and Eastern provinces not only constitutes the elimination of physical threats and danger but also addresses a national imperative aimed at restoring the dignity, livelihoods, and peaceful living conditions of the people.

title: President Dissanayake to leave for Vietnam today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to depart for Vietnam today (May 3), on a state visit at the invitation of the President of Vietnam, Luong Cuong.

title: Task Force appointed to combat Dengue & Chikungunya in Western Province
byline: A task force has been appointed to control the spread of Dengue and Chikungunya cases, says Secretary to the Ministry of Health of the Western Provincial Council L. A. Kalukapuarachchi.

title: Voting underway in Singapore as its long-ruling party seeks a bigger win
byline: Singaporeans were voting Saturday in a general election that is seen as the first key test of support for Prime Minister Lawrence Wong, who took office last year.

title: Sri Lanka’s Anudi Gunasekara to represent nation at 72nd Miss World Pageant
byline: Anudi Gunasekara, a Sri Lankan model and social activist, is set to represent Sri Lanka at the 72nd edition of the Miss World pageant, scheduled to take place in Hyderabad, Telangana, India, on 31 May 2025.

title: 2025 LG Polls: Five more candidates arrested for violating election laws
byline: Five additional candidates contesting the local government elections have been arrested in connection with various complaints, including violations of election laws, reported between 6:00 a.m. yesterday (May 2) and 6:00 a.m. today (May 3).

title: Notice on closure of vehicle revenue license counters in Western Province
byline: The Department of Government Information has announced that all counters responsible for issuing vehicle revenue licenses in the Western Province will remain closed on May 5 and 6, 2025, in view of the upcoming Local Government Elections scheduled for May 6, 2025.

title: Dan Priyasad’s murder: More details revealed on arrested shooter
byline: The suspect believed to be the gunman involved in the murder of political activist Dan Priyasad was arrested in the Cinnamon Gardens area of Colombo last afternoon (02) by officers from the Western Province South Crimes Division.

title: Woman dies when bomb she is carrying explodes in Greek city
byline: A woman was killed early Saturday in the northern Greek city of Thessaloniki when a bomb she was carrying exploded in her hands, police said.

title: Court allows 48-hour detention of gunman in Dan Priyasad murder
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today granted permission for the police to detain and interrogate the suspected shooter arrested in connection with the murder of political activist Dan Priyasad.

title: After banning imports, India now bars Pakistani ships from entering its ports
byline: After banning all imports from Pakistan, India on Saturday barred Pakistan-flagged ships from entering any of its ports, following the barbaric attack in Jammu and Kashmir’s Pahalgam, which took 26 lives.

title: Flight searched at BIA following alert over terror suspects
byline: A special search operation was conducted at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake today (3) following intelligence information received from India regarding the possible arrival of six suspects, allegedly linked to the recent Pahalgam terror attack in Kashmir.

title: Australian PM Anthony Albanese wins re-election
byline: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has become the first Australian prime minister to win a second consecutive three-year term in 21 years.

title: SriLankan Airlines issues clarification on flight subjected to security search
byline: SriLankan Airlines says that Flight UL 122, operated by aircraft 4R-ALS, which arrived in Colombo from Chennai at 11:59 hrs today (3 May), was subjected to a comprehensive security search upon arrival.

title: President Dissanayake leaves for state visit to Vietnam
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake departed for Vietnam a short while ago, commencing his official state visit to the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: 92 ex-LG members obtained over Rs. 620 mln as compensation for torched homes
byline: A total of 92 former local government representatives, including Pradeshiya Sabha and Municipal Council members, have obtained over Rs. 620 million as compensation for their residences destroyed during the ‘Aragalaya’ period, claims Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in for Central, Uva, Sabaragamuwa and Eastern provinces and in Hambantota and Polonnaruwa districts today (03), the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: Employees of banks & other financial institutions must be granted leave to vote – EC
byline: The Election Commission says that all employees who are employed in public and private sectors, including state and private banks and other financial institutions, must be granted leave to cast their vote without loss of leave or pay at the upcoming Local Government (LG) election, said in a statement today (03).

title: CID takes over probes into S’gamuwa Uni ragging incident, Kosgoda Police custodial death
byline: The investigation into the alleged ragging incident involving 23-year-old Charith Dilshan, a second-year student at the Faculty of Engineering Technology at Sabaragamuwa University, has been handed over to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).
